bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Frank J. Beardon. Bill of Costs.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p: In the District Court November Term A.D. 1885 at Cheney Territory of Washington County of Spokane}ss In the District Court of Washington Territory, and for the Fourth Judicial District thereof, holding terms at Cheney, Spokane County for Spokane, Lincoln and Douglass Counties. Novemeber Term A.D. 188 The Territory of Washington vs. Frank J. Beardon}1701 Indictment for Habeas Corpus for S.P. White a Witness COST BILL.

Docket & appearance .50 File afft. & Petition .20 Order for Habeas Corpus filed .10 Issue Writ 1.00 Serving original on sheriff 1.00 Returned file issue .35 Taxing costs .50 Two transcripts .80 Two Certificates 2.00 +6.45

Enter in serving writ of Habeas Corpus upon S.P. White at Initial Penitentiary at Seates in Thurston County and in conveying prisoner to and from the penitentiary to Cheney in Spokane County as a witness before the District Court.

Mileage from Cheney to Seates 467 mi. 46.70 Serving writ on Prisoner 1.00 Mileage from Seates to Cheney 467 miles 46.70 Mileage of Prisoner from Seates to Cheney 46.70 4 meals for prisoner 75 cents 3.00 Board of prisoner at Cheney 12 days @ 10 12.00 Mileage from Cheney to Seates. Returning prisoner to Penitentiary 467miles 46.70 4 meals for prisoner 75 cents 3.00 Mileage of Deputy from Seates to Cheney 467 miles} 46.70 $299.20
I hereby certify that I have examined the foregoing bill of costs, and that the same amounting to the sum of $305.65/100 is just and correct.
S.C. Hyde Prosecuting Attorney for Lincoln County.
I certified that I have examined the foregoing Bill of Costs, an amounting to the sum of $ and the same appearing to me to be just and correct, is hereby approved and allowed.
George Turner Associate Justice Supreme Court Washington Territory and Judge Fourth Judicial District

I, Clerk of the District Court of the Territory of Washington and for the Fourth Judicial District thereof, do hereby certify that the above and foregoing is a true and correct transcript of the costs in the above entitled cause, as the same now appears on record in my office.
In testimony whereof I have hereunto set my hand and affixed the seal of said Court, this day of A.D. 188_ Clerk By Deputy
In the District Court of Washington Territory. Fourth Judicial District.
The Territory of Washington vs. Franklin J. Beardon
